title: Would you stay in this ‘strange’ hotel run by ‘dinosaur robots’?
text:
Other Articles From 'Olaf' to 'Alex,' this mom sure knows how to make food 'fun' Black men likelier to die from prostate cancer than white counterparts Potential 'game-changer' Ebola vaccine proves 100 percent successful in trials A strange hotel in Japan may be the place for you if you are fascinated by dinosaurs, as it is being run by approximately 80 robots, including dinosaur robots.
Henn-na Hotel Nagasaki in Japan greets its customers by an incredibly realistic female robot sitting at the reception that even make similar expressions during the conversation just like any human receptionist would do and also have another less attractive receptionist cum dinosaur wearing bow tie, pill box hat, News.com.au reported.
Then, this high-tech hotel has a robotic porter that helps customers in carrying their luggage and reaching to the room that gets open via facial recognition system rather than using keys, wherein for any help customer can call a small lamp-sized robotic room concierge.
In addition to the robotic-touch, this hotel, which is located in the grounds of a theme park, Huis Ten Bosch, has air-conditioning that responds according to customer’s body temperature and room facilities that’s controlled through a tablet.
Above everything, the most lucrative point about this 72 room hotel is that even a budget traveler can afford it as its prices start at a very reasonable 7,000 yen i.e. 80 dollars per night.
 6:02 pm
